comments:
Build ID: BIRT runtime version 2.2.1 Eclipse version 3.0.2 (RAD 6.0.2.5)

Steps To Reproduce:
1.Install the BIRT 2.2.1 runtime in an existing working web application that uses wcm.jar and xml-apis.jar files or alternatively add wcm.jar file and xml-apis.jar to a working BIRT 2.2.1 application
2.On starting the application, the BIRT runtime fails to initialize and reports the error "org.eclipse.birt.report.exception.ViewerException: Fatal error occurred when try to startup report engine"
3.The log file generated in WEB-INF/platform/configuration folder suggests that the actual error is ClassCastException.
4.Although the problem was discovered in WebSphere 6.0.2.19 (running inside RAD 6.0.2.5) using Java 1.4.2, but, it should be reproducible in any web container using Java 1.4.2

Please let me know, if you need wcm.jar and/or xml-apis.jar file.

More information:

Hi, I can't reproduce the problem in TOMCAT 5.5.25.

1. Download the TOMCAT 5.5.25 with the 1.4 compat package.
2. Download the XML parser Xerces-J-bin.2.9.1.zip.
3. Install the TOMCAT and set the JAVA_HOME to J2SDK1.4.2_13
4. Deploy the BIRT in TOMCAT, copy all the JARs in Xerces-J-bin to WEB-INF/lib folder.
5. start the Tomcat
6. access the BIRT's sample report design.

It is correct which means BIRT starts up correctly in JDK1.4 with xml jars in the classpath.

Can you try to deploy your application to WAS6.0 or other J2EE container directly without RAD?

thanks.

The problem still persists with projects that had some older implementations of xml-api's. As far as my current project is concerned, I was able to get rid of the older (proprietary) implementations from the web projects that were going to use BIRT. BIRT upgrade to 2.2.1 works fine with those projects. You may close this as a bug.

traces.message: Fatal error occurred when try to startup report engine.
